s.text: It's a celebration of the fall harvest and the Jewish people's life in the desert while they waited to receive the torah.

I think we are reaching new levels of cynicism in New York City politics, which can only further alienate people from civic engagement.
Which brings me right to this week's great religious and civil-liberties controversy.
While the mayor may find the "dung and the virgin" exhibit offensive, as I would, it's an easy target to score points with upstate conservatives in his not yet announced Senate campaign.
